page.title: 04SCHOOLING IN KINGSCLERE
page.content: Children in Kingsclere may start in one of the three play-schools, which meet in the Youth Club or the Community Centre. In the school term in which you are five years of age you go to{Kingsclere {Primary School.}This now has modern buildings, the infant block having opened in 1972, and the junior block in 1980. The old buildings are soon to be sold and probably demolished. There is a swimming-pool, built in 1973, and a large field for playing football, rounders and other activities. In our school we use television, radio, a video-recorder, and our two micro-computers. After leaving their primary school at about eleven years of age, children go to the{Clere School}at Burghclere, five miles away. They travel there each day on one of several coaches.
